_comment: This is an attempt at creating a minimal, _flexible_ 'packet' of information capable of rendering a taxon on EOL (for now—other uses could be dreamt up).

identifiers._comment: note this one is missing a 'source'—this implies that the source is the same as the source of the taxa_pack.

identifiers.source: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

names._comment: Note that the order of names implies preference.

parts._comments: 'parts' is optional, and does NOT specify which keys are valid; it's up to the parser to handle each part as it cares to (clever parsers should make note of which part keys were not recognized, of course).

info._comment: 'info' nodes are optional, 'pseudo-free-form' additional information about the node to which they are attached; each hash in the array must have a 'type' and a 'value'; may optionally have 'units', optionally a 'source', and optionally a 'meta'—the 'meta' is kind of like a nested 'info', but does not allow 'source' (it must be the same as the parent info item) and does not itself allow a 'meta'. Values for 'type' are NOT enforced—again, the parser should handle them.

ancestors._comment: the order of ancestors is reverse: proximal relatives first; the intent of calling the string 'epithet' is to imply that the name should NOT include authority, etc.

literature_references._comment: 'title' and 'url' are optional, here; 'description' is required.
literature_references.title: Of the American Museum of Natural History
literature_references.description: 1991. Of the American Museum of Natural History. American Museum of Natural History. E.U.A.
INPN 2003-2014. Fiche descriptive de : Procyon lotor (Linnaeus, 1758), Muséum national d'Histoire naturelle. Service du Patrimoine naturel.

meta.value: CABI International Invasive Species Compendium, 2014. Procyon lotor.
Goldman EA, 1950. Raccoons of North and Middle America. Washingotn, D.C., USA: United States Government Printing Office, 153 pp. [North America Fauna 60.]

media._comment: media should be sorted in order of descending relevance (however the source decides to evaluate this). 'also_includes' is an array of IDs (from the source of the taxa_pack)
media.title: Procyon lotor (Raccoon)
media.body: Raccoon (Procyon lotor) on Clyde Lake, Ontario, Canada. Photographed on 4 October 2011.
